meanings.definition: Belonging to a period other than the one being portrayed
meanings.sent1: The knight wearing a wristwatch was anachronistic in the medieval play.
meanings.sent2: The antique phone in the modern office looked anachronistic.
meanings.sent3: The time-traveler's anachronistic sneakers caused quite a stir in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent4: Her love for vinyl records in the digital age felt anachronistic but charming.
meanings.sent5: The anachronistic carriages on the street made the historical reenactment truly authentic.

meanings.definition: Outdated or old-fashioned in a way that seems incongruous in the present time.
meanings.sent1: The professor's insistence on using a slide projector was anachronistic in the age of smart boards.
meanings.sent2: The rotary phone in the lobby seemed anachronistic compared to the sleek smartphones everyone carried.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa's love for typewriters was endearing but undeniably anachronistic.
meanings.sent4: Her fashion sense was so anachronistic, she could have stepped out of a vintage magazine.
meanings.sent5: The town's reliance on horse-drawn carriages was charmingly anachronistic in the era of cars.
